intro: Geissorhiza roseoalba, commonly known as the pink-stemmed lily, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking pinkish-white flowers with a distinctively colored stem. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its blooming period occurs during the late summer to early autumn months, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species.
